data.title: About: Gombe, Nigeria
data.meta_description: Gombe (Fula: Gelle/Wuro Gombe ğ¤ºğ¤«ğ¥…ğ¤¤ğ¥†ğ¤«/ğ¤±ğ¤µğ¥…ğ¤ªğ¤® ğ¤ºğ¤®ğ¤¥ğ¤¥ğ¤¦ğ¤«) is the capital city of Gombe State, north-eastern Nigeria, with an estimated population of 261,536. The city is the headquarters of Gombe State, a traditional city that covers most of Gombe State. Gombe state speak many languages like Hausa, Fulani, and Tangale among others. Recent development in the state includes the opening of the new Gombe Lawanti International Airport in 2008 and state-wide street solar installation.
